questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is good ___ mathematics.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'at'. 'She is good at mathematics.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'He is interested ___ music.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'in'. 'He is interested in music.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'The cat is hiding ___ the table.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'under'. 'The cat is hiding under the table.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She arrived ___ the airport on time.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'at'. 'She arrived at the airport on time.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'The book is ___ the shelf.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'on'. 'The book is on the shelf.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'He is afraid ___ the dark.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'of'. 'He is afraid of the dark.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is looking forward ___ the trip.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'to'. 'She is looking forward to the trip.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'The meeting is scheduled ___ Monday.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'on'. 'The meeting is scheduled on Monday.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'He is responsible ___ the project.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'for'. 'He is responsible for the project.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is married ___ a doctor.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'to'. 'She is married to a doctor.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'The train is ___ time.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'on'. 'The train is on time.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'He is good ___ playing the guitar.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'at'. 'He is good at playing the guitar.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is interested ___ learning new languages.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'in'. 'She is interested in learning new languages.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'The keys are ___ the table.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'on'. 'The keys are on the table.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'He is afraid ___ spiders.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'of'. 'He is afraid of spiders.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is looking forward ___ the weekend.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'to'. 'She is looking forward to the weekend.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'The meeting is scheduled ___ next week.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'for'. 'The meeting is scheduled for next week.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'He is responsible ___ the team's success.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'for'. 'He is responsible for the team's success.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is married ___ an engineer.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'to'. 'She is married to an engineer.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'The bus is ___ time.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'on'. 'The bus is on time.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'He is good ___ solving puzzles.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'at'. 'He is good at solving puzzles.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is interested ___ science.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'in'. 'She is interested in science.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'The book is ___ the desk.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'on'. 'The book is on the desk.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'He is afraid ___ heights.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'of'. 'He is afraid of heights.'

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is looking forward ___ the holidays.'
questions.explanation: The correct preposition is 'to'. 'She is looking forward to the holidays.'
